newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia's Rostelekom - transfer to Svyazinvest done.
newsitem.headline: Russia's Rostelekom - transfer to Svyazinvest done.

text.p: The Russian government's controlling block of shares in long-distance telecom group Rostelekom has been transferred to telecoms holding company Svyazinvest, Rostelekom's chief executive said on Monday.

Oleg Belov told Reuters that arrangements with the State Property Committee had been completed according to a presidential decree ordering the transfer of 38 percent of Rostelekom shares, or 51 percent of voting stock, to Svyazinvest.
"The paperwork is done," he said after a news conference.

A 25 percent plus one share stake in Svyazinvest, which holds controlling stakes in 89 regional telecoms and communications companies, will be auctioned shortly at a starting price of $1.18 billion, privatisation officials say.
